data.title: Avon High School
data.text:
The Avon Band performs and competes at the highest level available and strives to be the best in all we do while providing accountability and excellence for our performers. We give every student a safe place to express their music through whatever ensemble they choose. We want each student to express who they are, and to be their best.

The Band program is open to any Avon High School Student. Students may participate in the following ensembles:

Marching Black & Gold Winter Guard Drumline Indoor Winds Concert Band Saxophone Ensemble Brass Choir

Jazz Ensemble

Learn More

The Avon Black & Gold Dance Teams consist of students that have a passion for dance and a commitment to excellence. Throughout the year the teams perform at home football games, basketball games, pep sessions, community festivals, dance recitals, and competitions.

Our 2020-21 JV Dance Team auditions will be held at the start of the school year!

ALL INFORMATION REGARDING SCHEDULING AND CALENDARS WILL BE RELEASED VIA CHARMS! CURRENT MEMBERS, PLEASE CHECK YOUR ACCOUNT!

The AHS Theatre program—Avon Thespians Troupe #8320—is an officially chartered troupe through Indiana Thespians. By working in the theatre, you can apply to be inducted as an official Thespian.

Director: Mrs. Caitlyn Steckbeck

Student Elected Board: Ian Lynam (President), Ian Brooks (Vice-President), Abby Lex (Membership and Recruitment Chair), Emma Cremeans (Marketing and Publicity Chair); Aubrey Starr (Junior Ambassador), Kate Lynam (Sophomore Ambassador).

Indiana State Thespian Officer: Ian Lynam

All Avon Theatre productions have tickets sold through BookTix.com. Once you create an account, you are all set to purchase tickets for current productions.

"Once again, our community has received the Best Communities for Music Education award. It is one of those things we seem to win every year. But, it's because of [our] students. It's because we have principals and teachers who support the arts. This is a community celebration. It is celebrating that this entire community equals excellence in music education."

Dean Westman

Director of Orchestras & Performing Arts Department Chair
